str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and kopto; to amputate; reflexively to mutilate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cord, rope. Diminutive of schoinos; a rushlet, i.e. Grass-withe or tie.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A boat; any hollow vessel. A 'skiff', or yawl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To allow, permit, let alone, leave. Of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. Permit or leave alone.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
